net.sf.jguiraffe.di.impl

Class AbstractDependentProviderTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jguiraffe.di.impl.AbstractDependentProviderTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestDefaultBeanContext, TestDefaultDependencyProvider

    public abstract class AbstractDependentProviderTest
extends Object
    An abstract base class for unit tests that test dependency resolving between bean providers. This class provides some basic functionality for creating dependency chains using mock objects.
    Version:
    $Id: AbstractDependentProviderTest.java 205 2012-01-29 18:29:57Z oheger $
    Author:
    Oliver Heger

      Stores the running index of the provider names.

      Stores a list with the mock providers created during a test.
      protected static String NAME_PREFIX
      Constant with the prefix of the provider names.
      protected DefaultBeanStore store
      The bean store, on which the test operates.

        public void tearDown()
              throws Exception

      • getProviderName

        protected String getProviderName(int idx)
        Returns the name of the test provider with the specified index.
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the provider
        Returns:
        the name for this provider

      • createProviderMock

        protected BeanProvider createProviderMock()
        Creates a bean provider mock object. The mock is stored in the internal list. It is not yet initialized.
        Returns:
        the mock provider object

      • createProviderMock

        protected BeanProvider createProviderMock(boolean noLock,
                                          String... dependencies)
        Creates a bean provider mock object and performs initialization. This is a short cut for createProviderMock(noLock, 1, dependencies).
        Parameters:
        noLock - flag whether the getLock() method should be initialized
        dependencies - the names of the dependent providers
        Returns:
        the mock provider object

      • createProviderMock

        protected BeanProvider createProviderMock(boolean noLock,
                                          int invocationCount,
                                          String... dependencies)
        Creates a bean provider mock object and performs initialization for the given times of expected invocations. The specified dependencies are set. If the noLock argument is true, the getLock() method will be initialized to return null.
        Parameters:
        noLock - flag whether the getLock() method should be initialized
        invocationCount - the expected number of invocations
        dependencies - the names of the dependent providers
        Returns:
        the mock provider object

      • replayProviders

        protected void replayProviders()
        Calls replay() on all created provider mock objects.

      • nextIndex

        protected int nextIndex()
        Increments the index for the name generation of mock providers and returns the current index.
        Returns:
        the current index

      • addProvider

        protected int addProvider(BeanProvider provider)
        Adds the provider to the bean store under a default name. The index of this name is returned.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to add
        Returns:
        the name of this provider

      • createProviderChain

        protected int createProviderChain(int count,
                                  boolean cycle)
        Creates a chain of provider objects where the provider i depends on provider i + 1. This is a short form of createProviderChain(count, cycle, 1).
        Parameters:
        count - the number of providers in the chain
        cycle - a flag if a cycle is to be created
        Returns:
        the index of the first provider in the chain

      • createProviderChain

        protected int createProviderChain(int count,
                                  boolean cycle,
                                  int invocationCount)
        Creates a chain of provider objects where the provider i depends on provider i + 1. If desired, the chain can be cyclic, i.e. provider n depends on provider 1. The number of expected invocations of the mock objects can also be specified.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of providers in the chain
        cycle - a flag if a cycle is to be created
        invocationCount - the number of expected invocations
        Returns:
        the index of the first provider in the chain

      • getProviders

        protected Collection<BeanProvider> getProviders(int fromIndex,
                                                int toIndex)
        Returns a collection with the mock providers in the specified index range.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the from index
        toIndex - the to index (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the collection with the specified providers
